body_html: It's really difficult to follow what you are asking. TensorFlow computes gradients w.r.t. to scalar functions. I.e. usually you do tf.gradients on a loss which is a scalar (and if there is a batch, it will be some reduction across that batch too). If you give it a vector function it implicitly sums it first. I'd suggest you setup an example with concrete things and make sure it is giving what you expect.

body: It's really difficult to follow what you are asking. TensorFlow computes gradients w.r.t. to scalar functions. I.e. usually you do tf.gradients on a loss which is a scalar (and if there is a batch, it will be some reduction across that batch too). If you give it a vector function it implicitly sums it first.   I'd suggest you setup an example with concrete things and make sure it is giving what you expect.
